<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This file implements the Aggressive Dead Code Elimination pass.  This pass</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// optimistically assumes that all instructions are dead until proven otherwise,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// allowing it to eliminate dead computations that other DCE passes do not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// catch, particularly involving loop computations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00674" /><CodeLine lineNumber="674"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> AggressiveDeadCodeElimination::computeReversePostOrder() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00675" /><CodeLine lineNumber="675"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This provides a post-order numbering of the reverse control flow graph</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00676" /><CodeLine lineNumber="676"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Note that it is incomplete in the presence of infinite loops but we don&#39;t</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00677" /><CodeLine lineNumber="677"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// need numbers blocks which don&#39;t reach the end of the functions since</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00678" /><CodeLine lineNumber="678"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// all branches in those blocks are forced live.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00679" /><CodeLine lineNumber="679"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00680" /><CodeLine lineNumber="680"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For each block without successors, extend the DFS from the block</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00681" /><CodeLine lineNumber="681"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// backward through the graph</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00682" /><CodeLine lineNumber="682"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrset">SmallPtrSet&lt;BasicBlock&#42;, 16&gt;</a> Visited;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00684" /><CodeLine lineNumber="684"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &amp;BB : <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00686" /><CodeLine lineNumber="686"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">continue</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00736" /><CodeLine lineNumber="736"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Only removing debug instructions does not affect MemorySSA.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00737" /><CodeLine lineNumber="737"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00738" /><CodeLine lineNumber="738"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Therefore we preserve MemorySSA when only removing debug instructions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00739" /><CodeLine lineNumber="739"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// since otherwise later passes may behave differently which then makes</span></CodeLine>
